description: covered goblet; wide foot below urn-shaped stem; rounded bowl; domed cover; foot has repeating leaf design around edge with fluting at center; long thin leaves on urn on stem; fluting at underside of bowl; cover has radiating cross on knob; radiating leaves at center of cover; floral swags joining four winged heads at edges of cover; gold patina
text: Like his spice box, Belli's footed pyxis serves as a container. But the theological context and meaning could not be more different. In Catholicism, the pyxis serves as a receptacle for the consecrated host—the most sacred of entities, which requires protection from possible profanation. The decoration of the rim with four cherub's heads refers to the teaching that the liturgy performed on earth is mirrored by an angelic liturgy in heaven.
title: Travel pyxis
